Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov

Class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelCalculatorCommon, ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    public class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov
extends ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo

    Computes the differential conditional transfer entropy (TE) between two univariate double[] time-series of observations (implementing ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator), using Kraskov-Stoegbauer-Grassberger (KSG) estimation (see references below). This estimator is realised here by plugging in a ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov as the calculator into the parent class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo.

    Crucially, the calculation is performed by examining neighbours in the full joint space (as specified by Frenzel and Pompe, and Gomez-Herrero et al.) rather than two MI calculators.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator, with:

    • The constructor step is either a simple call to ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov(), or else specifies which KSG algorithm to implement via ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov(String);
    • setProperty(String, String) allowing properties defined for both ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator.setProperty(String, String) and ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.setProperty(String, String) as outlined in ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo.setProperty(String, String)); as well as for PROP_KRASKOV_ALG_NUM.
    • Computed values are in nats, not bits!

    References:

    • T. Schreiber, "Measuring information transfer", Physical Review Letters 85 (2) pp.461-464, 2000.
    • Frenzel and Pompe, "Partial Mutual Information for Coupling Analysis of Multivariate Time Series", Physical Review Letters, 99, p. 204101+ (2007).
    • G. Gomez-Herrero, W. Wu, K. Rutanen, M. C. Soriano, G. Pipa, and R. Vicente, "Assessing coupling dynamics from an ensemble of time series", arXiv:1008.0539 (2010).
    • Kraskov, A., Stoegbauer, H., Grassberger, P., "Estimating mutual information", Physical Review E 69, (2004) 066138.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Local information transfer as a spatiotemporal filter for complex systems" Physical Review E 77, 026110, 2008.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Information modification and particle collisions in distributed computation" Chaos 20, 3, 037109 (2010).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier, email, www
    See Also:
    ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator, ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        public void initialise​(int k,
                       int k_tau,
                       int l,
                       int l_tau,
                       int delay,
                       int[] condEmbedDims,
                       int[] cond_taus,
                       int[] condDelays)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Initialise the calculator with all required parameters for embeddings and delays supplied. All other parameters remain unchanged.
        Specified by:
        initialise in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Overrides:
        initialise in class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Parameters:
        k - Length of destination past history to consider
        k_tau - embedding delay for the destination variable
        l - length of source past history to consider
        l_tau - embedding delay for the source variable
        delay - time lag between last element of source and destination next value
        condEmbedDims - array of embedding lengths for each conditional variable. Can be an empty array or null if there are no conditional variables.
        cond_taus - array of embedding delays for the conditional variables. Must be same length as condEmbedDims array.
        condDelays - array of time lags between last element of each conditional variable and destination next value. Must be same length as condEmbedDims array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for inconsistent arguments, e.g. if array lengths differ between condEmbedDims, cond_taus and condDelays.

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets properties for the TE calculator. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, include:

        • PROP_KRASKOV_ALG_NUM -- which Kraskov algorithm number to use (1 or 2). Will only be applied at the next initialisation.
        • Any valid properties for ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo.setProperty(String, String)
        • Any valid properties for ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.setProperty(String, String)

        One should set ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.PROP_K here, the number of neighbouring points one should count up to in determining the joint kernel size.

        Note: further properties may be defined by child classes.

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Overrides:
        setProperty in class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem with the supplied value).
